title: Revealed: The worst – and best – hotel chains in Britain
text:
Britannia Hotels has been rated Britain’s worst hotel chain for the seventh year running in an annual poll by Which?, the consumer watchdog.

Guests were 10 times more likely to award it a poor rating for cleanliness than any other hotel, a survey of the magazine’s readers found.

At the other end of the table, Premier Inn tied with Wetherspoon Hotels for top spot.

Britannia, which has 61 branches across the country, was given one-star ratings in nearly all categories included in the survey, and an overall customer score of 39 per cent.
